events.description: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) led by Sanae Takaichi secured a two-thirds supermajority in the House of Representatives.

facts.fact_text: The Topix Index gained 2.2% to 3,780 on Monday.

evidences.evidence_text: the broader Topix Index gained 2.2% to 3,780 on Monday

facts.fact_text: The LDP-led coalition won 352 of the 465 seats in Japan’s House of Representatives.

evidences.evidence_text: Takaichi’s coalition won 352 of the 465 seats in Japan’s House of Representatives

facts.fact_text: SoftBank Group shares rose 6%, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries rose 3.2%, and Toyota Motor rose 2.3%.

evidences.evidence_text: Strong performers included heavyweights firms such as SoftBank Group (6%), Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (3.2%) and Toyota Motor (2.3%).

claims.claim_text: The election outcome reinforced expectations for looser fiscal policy and possible tax cuts.

evidences.evidence_text: The outcome reinforced expectations for looser fiscal policy and possible tax cuts

claims.claim_text: There are concerns over Japan’s growing debt burden.

evidences.evidence_text: amid concerns over Japan’s growing debt burden

evidence.evidence_text: Japanese shares hitting fresh record highs after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party... secured a two-thirds supermajority
Japanese equities also benefited from Wall Street gains on Friday
expectations for looser fiscal policy and possible tax cuts, which have rattled Japanese financial markets in recent weeks amid concerns over Japan’s growing debt burden
